intro: Oreocome hindukushensis, commonly known as the Hindukush oreocome, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Hindukush range in Afghanistan and Pakistan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming a dense cluster. Oreocome hindukushensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to alpine conditions and its potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
